module.name: schedule
module.keywords: module, systems engineering, schedule, scheme, project management

abstract.li: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of a data model that identifies activities, dependencies, durations and milestones associated with products described in a work breakdown structure. This would include the information necessary to produce Workflow Diagrams, Network Schedules, Gantt Charts and Resource Leveling.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of a data model that identifies activities, dependencies, durations and milestones associated with products described in a work breakdown structure. This would include the information necessary to produce Workflow Diagrams, Network Schedules, Gantt Charts and Resource Leveling..

Systems Engineering encompasses the design and specification of systems, the planning and management of the engineering processes that design, manufacture, field, and support for that system. Within organizations and between organizations it is beneficial to be able to exchange plans and schedules. These may be at a high level where they deal with the tasks of work breakdown structure or at low and detailed level where they coordinate individual workers. This module captures information concerning schedules, resource allocation and leveling. This information is needed to manage the life cycle process of developing and using a system such that persons and organizations can coordinate their activities.
This AP233 business case module is constructed from several ISO/TS Application modules.

The module captures the definition of an activity. An activity is a work element, function or task. It captures the relationship between two activities that might be on sequential, concurrent, or alternative paths. It captures the relationship between an activity and inputs and outputs from the activity, i.e. the product or activity data that it generates or uses.

The module captures planned or defined activities that will occur in the future. It captures the historical occurrence of an activity and the relationship of the planned activity to the actual historical occurrence of the activity.
The module captures the identification and description. It provides a foundation for more detailed and specific specifications of how particular activities are to be performed.
The module captures relationships between activity methods. It captures the assignment of activity methods to product data.
The module provides the capability to associate additional information with an activity method.
The module provides the association of a value, represented by a class, to an attribute of an entity.
The module provides assignment of classification information to product or activity data.

The module captures the conditions that impact an activity or its execution. Condition is specified by a textual description with a logical result or by external entities as input to a condition expression. It captures the assignment of conditions to activities and relationships among conditions.
The module captures the characterization of an event. It captures characterization of a relationship between two events and the characterization of an event with respect to another event.
The module provides the:

ul.li: faculty to assign management data to product data;
faculty to assign management data to activity data;
faculty to assign management data to management data;
assignment of management data to management data.

purpose.p: The module captures the specification of a property of an activity, the representation of a property of an activity, or the use of an independent property in the definition of an activity.
The module provides for the:

ul.li: assignment of a property to product data;
use of an independent property in the definition of an item;
association of a representation with a property.

purpose.p: The module captures the recording of resources used or consumed by activities. It captures the usage or consumption of actual resources and types of resource items. It captures the relationship between the resource actually applied and realized with the corresponding resource requirement statements. It captures the relationship between the resource as realized and the corresponding resource events.
The module captures the definition of a resource and the definition of a grouping of resources as a resource in its own right.

The module captures the availability of a resource. It captures the planning and recording of resource provision, the allocation and issuing of a resource, and the relationships between allocated resources and the corresponding resource requirements.

The module captures the definition of a property that may be associated with a resource or related element. It captures the representation of a property that may be associated with a resource or related element; the use of an independent property in the definition of a resource, and the means to assign a property to a resource or related element. The entity property includes time intervals.

The module captures the identification of schemes that support the ordering of activities. It captures the identification of entries in a scheme, and the association of dates and times with schemes and entries in schemes. It captures the definition of relationships between entries within a scheme, including dependencies and sequencing. It captures the definition of relationships between schemes, and the definition of relationships between scheme entries and schemes that expand on entries.

The module captures the specification of a task as a sequence of instructions encoded as text. It captures the specification of a task as a structured set of instructions. It captures the association of pre-conditions to a task or a stage within a task, the association of post-conditions to a task or a stage within a task, and the assignment of a task.

ul.li: As part of our AP233 evaluation work we are looking on how best to implement the Scheme module. We identified a couple of problems and think it is best to make several changes for our trial implementation:

This e-mail focuses on changes for Scheme only, but please have in mind the neighbouring modules for Task_specification and Activity, Project etc. as well. At the end all this has to work in a consistent way. I did not list Activity_as_realize here because I think we don't need the entities defined there - this is a separate debate.

Note that the changes listed below shall help to improve data exchange and data_integration of different tools. The pre- and post-processor may not know from each other - so they may not be aligned up-front.
